form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to conduct a longitudinal study of the vocational rehabilitation programs administered by the Secretary.

section.header: Longitudinal study of Department of Veterans Affairs vocational rehabilitation programs

subsection.text: Chapter 31 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Longitudinal study of vocational rehabilitation programs

subsection.text: The Secretary shall conduct a longitudinal study of a statistically valid sample of the veterans who begin participating in a vocational rehabilitation program under this chapter during fiscal year 2008. The Secretary shall conduct such study over a period of at least 20 years.

By not later than July 1 of each year covered by the study required under subsection (a), the Secretary shall submit to the Committees on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate and House of Representatives a report on the study during the preceding year.

The Secretary shall include in the report required under subsection (b) any data the Secretary determines is necessary to determine the long-term outcomes of the veterans participating in the vocational rehabilitation programs under this chapter. The Secretary may add data elements from time to time as necessary. Each such report shall contain the following information:

paragraph.text: The number of veterans participating in vocational rehabilitation programs under this chapter who suspended participation in such a program during the year covered by the report.
The average number of months such veterans served on active duty.
The average disability rating of such veterans.
The types of other benefits administered by the Secretary received by such veterans.
The types of social security benefits received by such veterans.
Any unemployment benefits received by such veterans.
The average number of months such veterans were employed during the year covered by the report.
The average annual starting and ending salaries such veterans who were employed during the year covered by the report.
The number of such veterans enrolled in an institution of higher learning, as that term is defined in section 3452(f) of this title.
The average number of college credits and degrees obtained by such veterans during the year covered by the report.
The average number of visits such veterans made to Department medical facilities during the year covered by the report.
The average number of visits such veterans made to non-Department medical facilities during the year covered by the report.
The average total household income of such veterans for the year covered by the report.
The percentage of such veterans who own their principal residences.
The average number of dependents of each such veteran.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 3122. Longitudinal study of vocational rehabilitation programs.
